扒.definition: to rake up; to steal; to braise; to crawl

扒屋牽牛.definition: to sack the home and lead off the cattle (proverb); to strip of everything

扒拉.definition: (coll.) to push food from one's bowl into one's mouth with chopsticks (usu. hurriedly)

扒摟.definition: to gather together as with a rake; to shovel food into one's mouth; to eat fast

扒皮.definition: to flay; to skin; (fig.) to exploit; to take advantage of

扒竊.definition: to steal; to pick pockets; to frisk

扒糕.definition: buckwheat pudding (snack of buckwheat noodles with sauce)

扒糞.definition: muckraking; to stir up scandal; to expose (corruption)

扒車.definition: to pull oneself up onto a moving vehicle

扒開.definition: to pry open or apart; to spread (sth) open with both hands

扒飯.definition: to push food into one's mouth using chopsticks while holding one's bowl up to one's mouth

扒高踩低.definition: crawl high, step low (idiom); unprincipled crawling, flattering one's superiors and trampling on one's juniors; toadying and bullying
